With skip-the-line access, explore this architectural wonder alongside an official guide, who will unveil the fascinating history, symbolism, and intricate details behind Gaudí’s greatest work. what_is_included: • Official guide with expert knowledge of the Sagrada Familia • Skip-the-line access to Sagrada Familia • Guided tour to explore Gaudí’s architectural masterpiece what_is_not_included: • Transportation to/from the meeting point • Meals and beverages highlights: • Explore Gaudí’s greatest masterpiece, the Sagrada Familia. • Enjoy skip-the-line access for a smooth entry • Discover the fascinating history and symbolism with an official guide • Marvel at the intricate details of one of the world’s most extraordinary basilicas check_in_details: Please, be at the check in point 15 minutes before departure time. what_to_bring: Tours proceed rain or shine; dress appropriately. disclaimers: There is a minimum of people required to operate the tour. activities.name: Barcelona Gaudí & Modernism Tour
activities.description: Antoni Gaudí’s incredible buildings are a monument not just to his distinctive genius but to the spirit of a generation. The 19th-century Catalan Renaissance saw the cultural rebirth of a nation that reached its peak with the Modernisme movement. Gaudí and his contemporaries took the spirit of the times and mixed modern techniques with traditional craftsmanship to enrich Barcelona. Ever since then, millions have enjoyed this beautiful architectural heritage and visited the masterpieces of Modernisme. This two-hour walking tour explores the beautiful Eixample district where the best examples can be easily discovered on foot, leading to the unfinished masterpiece of Sagrada Família. This unique building is a bridge between the twin historic highlights of Catalan culture: the medieval merchant city and the 19th-century industrial metropolis. It combines tremendous views over the city Gaudí loved with fascinating insights into his creative mind. No visit to Barcelona is complete without this UNESCO World Heritage Site, with its breathtaking spires. The tour is much more than a series of photo opportunities (although don’t forget your camera!). We dig deep into the roots of the movement and explore the social unrest and political issues that the glossy guidebooks ignore. The result is an unforgettable portrait of one of the world’s greatest cities and a tribute to some of its most talented designers. *Average tour length. The independent guides with whom we work have your best interests in mind; while the tour usually includes the sites and stories above and lasts this long, your tour may vary depending on what your guide thinks is best for your group! Take advantage of our group discount of 10% for groups of 10 or more!

activities.name: The best of Spain in 10 Days – All-Inclusive from Barcelona
activities.description: duration: 9 days cancellation_summary: In case of cancellation, 15% or 50% is non-refundable depending on the notice period, plus applicable third-party costs. meeting_point: Elevate your Spanish Adventure: Unforgettable moments, Exclusively yours max_age: 99 group_size: 12 pricing: 1.331€ description: Discover Spain’s rich cultural and culinary soul on this 9-day journey. From Gaudí’s iconic Barcelona and the medieval charm of Girona, to the coastal beauty of the Costa Brava, the imperial legacy of Madrid, Segovia, Avila and Toledo, and the southern soul of Andalusia’s cities—Córdoba, Málaga, Ronda, and Seville—this experience brings you into the heart of each region. Indulge in authentic gourmet experiences, uncover centuries of history, and connect deeply with the local culture. what_is_included: • Guided walking tour of Barcelona and entrance tickets to Sagrada Familia • Montserrat, Girona and Costa Brava guided tours • Gourmet tapas tour & market bites in Madrid • Three cities in one day from Madrid tour: Segovia, Avila and Toledo • Toledo winery experience with tasting • Córdoba guided visit with Mezquita entrance • Day tour to Ronda, white villages and Seville from Malaga • Seville Tapas Tour & Flamenco Show • Transportation in premium air-conditioned vehicle or high-speed train • 9 nights in 4-star hotels (or equivalent) with daily breakfast if selected what_is_not_included: • Meals and drinks not detailed in the program • Flights, transfers, and train tickets not specified • Monument entrance fees during free time • Gratuities and personal expenses • Accommodation (unless selected) • City taxes and hotel incidentals • Personal expenses • Travel insurance (highly recommended) itinerary: DAY 1: BARCELONA Arrive independently in the vibrant city of Barcelona and check in to your accommodation. Begin your adventure with some free time to explore the city at your own pace. Stroll down the elegant Passeig de Gràcia, admire the iconic façades of Casa Batlló and La Pedrera, or lose yourself in the winding streets of the Gothic Quarter. If you prefer to unwind, Barceloneta beach offers the perfect spot to relax by the sea. In the afternoon, your private journey officially begins with the Barcelona Best Walking Tour. Led by a local expert, this immersive experience takes you through the city’s historic heart before culminating in a guided visit to the Sagrada Familia—Gaudí’s awe-inspiring masterpiece. With fast-track access, step inside this architectural wonder and discover the rich symbolism and visionary design that make it one of the most iconic buildings in the world. As the sun sets, treat yourself to a rooftop drink with views over the city or enjoy a Mediterranean dinner in the atmospheric Born district. If you select the accommodation upgrade, enjoy a stay at H10 Urquinaona Plaza, a 4-star boutique hotel housed in a restored 19th-century building just steps from Plaça Catalunya—one of the most privileged locations in the city. DAY 2: MONTSERRAT & GIRONA Begin the day with a visit to Montserrat, Catalonia’s sacred mountain. Its dramatic, jagged peaks set the stage for a deeply atmospheric experience. Visit the Benedictine monastery and see the Black Madonna—La Moreneta, a symbol of devotion for centuries. Your guide will lead you through the basilica, cloister, and main square, combining history, spirituality, and breathtaking views.In the afternoon, continue to Girona, one of Spain’s most beautiful medieval cities. Upon arrival, enjoy a guided walking tour through its Gothic cathedral, historic Jewish Quarter, Eiffel bridge, and ancient city walls. Rather than returning to Barcelona, you’ll stay the night—because Girona after dark is truly special. As day visitors leave, the city transforms: locals fill the terraces, the Onyar River glows under warm streetlights, and the air is filled with history, music, and the aromas of Catalan cuisine. If you select the accommodation upgrade, you’ll stay at the DoubleTree by Hilton Girona, a contemporary hotel just a short walk from the historic center. Known for its comfort, service, and ideal location, it’s the perfect base for your night in Girona. DAY 3: GIRONA & COSTA BRAVA After a relaxed breakfast at your hotel, you’ll have the morning to enjoy Girona at your own pace. Dive deeper into its charm—visit the Jewish History Museum, browse artisan shops, or enjoy a classic vermut in one of the hidden squares of the Old Town. Mornings in Girona are calm and luminous, perfect for strolling without rush, discovering local gems, or savoring a slow coffee in Plaça del Vi or Plaça de la Independencia as the city gently comes to life. You’ll also have time to enjoy lunch in one of Girona’s excellent local restaurants, where Catalan cuisine blends tradition with creativity. Around mid-afternoon, your journey continues to the Costa Brava, where you’ll discover Tossa de Mar, one of its most enchanting seaside towns. Walk along the medieval castle walls—the only ones by the sea in Catalonia—with stunning views over the bay. Tossa is more than a beach town—it embodies the wild coastline, Mediterranean charm, and timeless beauty of the Costa Brava. In the evening, return to Barcelona with lasting memories of culture, nature, and local flavor. With the accommodation upgrade, enjoy a second night at H10 Urquinaona Plaza, your elegant retreat in the of the city. DAY 4: BARCELONA & MADRID Board a high-speed AVE train from Barcelona to Madrid, arriving in the heart of the capital. Enjoy some free time to explore at your own pace—whether visiting the Royal Palace, the Prado Museum, or simply strolling through elegant streets and lively squares, Madrid offers endless options. In the evening, join one of our most beloved food experiences: the Tapas & Markets Tour in Madrid. This 4.5-hour tour, led by a local culinary expert, takes you through iconic districts like La Latina, Los Austrias, and Barrio de las Letras, while sampling a curated mix of classic tapas—mushrooms, Iberian ham, garlic shrimp, carrilleras—paired with fine wines and craft drinks. It ends on a rooftop terrace with panoramic city views and a cocktail in hand. Afterwards, enjoy the evening at your leisure—perhaps in Plaza Santa Ana or a nearby tavern, soaking in the capital’s night-time energy. With the accommodation upgrade, stay at H10 Tribeca, a modern 4-star hotel with design-forward comfort and excellent access to Madrid’s cultural and gastronomic hotspots. DAY 5: MADRID, SEGOVIA, ÁVILA & TOLEDO Begin early in Madrid and head to the first stop of the day: Segovia, one of Spain’s architectural gems. Marvel at the iconic Roman aqueduct, explore the fairytale Alcázar, and wander through its winding streets filled with history. Next, head to Ávila, a UNESCO World Heritage city famed for its towering medieval walls. In the afternoon, continue to Toledo - once the capital of Spain and a place where Christian, Jewish, and Muslim cultures intertwine. Visit its iconic cathedral, a Gothic masterpiece and symbol of the city’s historical richness. As the sun sets, Toledo transforms. Golden lights illuminate ancient alleys, quiet plazas invite you to pause, and the rhythm of the city slows. Enjoy the evening at your leisure—perhaps with dinner in a traditional tavern, savoring regional flavors in an unforgettable setting. With the accommodation upgrade, spend the night at Eurostars Toledo, a modern 4-star hotel offering spacious rooms, excellent service, and a peaceful atmosphere—perfectly positioned to access the historic heart of the city. DAY 6: TOLEDO & MADRID Wake up in the heart of Toledo, where the early light casts a warm glow over ancient stone streets. After breakfast, enjoy a free morning to experience the city at your own rhythm. Whether you seek culture, calm, or light adventure, Toledo offers it all—take in views from the Mirador del Valle, relax in a quiet café, or rent an e-bike to explore the surrounding hills. In the early afternoon, meet your guide and leave the city behind for the peaceful landscapes of Castilla-La Mancha. Rolling hills and vineyards welcome you to a traditional boutique winery. Here, you'll enjoy a guided walk through the vineyard and cellar, learning about the region’s unique winemaking heritage. The experience concludes with a tasting of three local wines— a perfect moment to slow down and savor. Afterwards, return to Madrid. With the accommodation upgrade, enjoy a return stay at H10 Tribeca, offering style, comfort, and great access to the city's vibrant core. DAY 7: CORDOBA & MALAGA Start your day in Madrid and take a high-speed train to Córdoba for a day immersed in Andalusian history. Upon arrival, meet your expert guide for a cultural journey through this UNESCO World Heritage city, starting with its most iconic landmark: the Mezquita-Catedral. Inside, discover the fusion of Islamic and Christian architecture—striped arches, a magnificent mihrab, and a cathedral nave rising within a former mosque, all under one extraordinary roof.After the guided visit, enjoy free time to explore on your own, try local specialties like salmorejo, or relax in a sun-dappled plaza. In the late afternoon, continue south to Málaga, where the city welcomes you with its warm coastal light and Mediterranean energy. As night falls, take the opportunity to discover its vibrant old town, dine in a lively tapas bar, or enjoy a rooftop cocktail with sea breeze and skyline views—the perfect first taste of the Costa del Sol. With the accommodation upgrade, stay at NH Málaga, a stylish 4-star hotel ideally located between the historic center and the Guadalmedina River—offering modern comfort and direct access to the city’s cultural and gastronomic scene. DAY 8: MALAGA, RONDA, WHITE VILLAGES & SEVILLE Start your day with a guided journey through the heart of Andalusia, visiting three of its most iconic spots. Begin in Ronda, a dramatic mountaintop town known for the Puente Nuevo, sweeping views, and elegant old streets. Walk its scenic paths and explore the Moorish gardens of Alameda del Tajo. Continue through one of the region’s White Villages, where whitewashed houses, narrow lanes, and flower-filled balconies define the charm of rural Andalusia. Take time to explore, enjoy the views, and soak in the tranquil atmosphere. By afternoon, arrive in Seville, the soulful capital of the south. Take in the grandeur of Plaza de España, stroll the orange-scented streets of Santa Cruz, and admire exterior views of the Cathedral and Royal Alcázar. Seville by night invites you out—tapas bars, leafy patios, and the sound of flamenco create a perfect end to your day. With the accommodation upgrade, stay at H10 Corregidor Boutique Hotel, a stylish 4-star property built around a traditional Andalusian patio, ideally located in Seville’s Old Town. DAY 9: SEVILLE Enjoy your final morning in Seville with free time to explore at your own pace. Visit the Royal Alcázar, climb the Giralda tower, or step inside the Cathedral—one of the largest in the world. If you prefer to take it slow, stroll through María Luisa Park, browse artisan shops, or enjoy a relaxed lunch in a buzzing tapas bar. Seville invites you to savor every corner at your own rhythm. In the afternoon, join the Sevilla Tapas Delights Walking Tour & Flamenco Show. Your guide will lead you through picturesque streets, stopping at three selected venues to sample traditional and modern tapas, paired with local wines. Along the way, discover the flavors and spirit highlights: • Exclusive experiences across Spain’s most iconic regions • Guided tours in each location • Discover the rich history, vibrant culture, and diverse gastronomy in each location • Comfortable travel in a small group with expert local guide • Optional premium hotel package in each destination with carefully selected 4-star stays check_in_details: • Please, be at the check in point 15’ minutes before departure time. • This product is subject to cancellation or rescheduling based on inclement weather.

activities.name: Luis de Arquer: Solo Chopin in Barcelona
activities.description: Explore the beauty of piano music at El Teatre més Petit del Món in Barcelona, where masterworks from Frederic Chopin come to life in this incredible performance. Solo Chopin, is the tribute of the pianist and composer Luis de Arquer to Frédéric Chopin, a piano recital that immerses us in some of the most beautiful works of his music, which even after more than 200 years, is still as close to our emotions as then thanks to its great beauty, romanticism and sensitivity. The Teatre més Petit del Món, is one more of those small halls where Chopin himself preferred to appear before a brief and select audience, where it was possible that singular communion that is lived through each sound...

activities.name: Casa Batlló Guided Tour with Entrance to White Rabbit Museum
activities.description: The visit will begin outside Casa Batlló, as its imposing façade will leave you in awe. Its undulating balconies and the bright colors of Antoni Gaudí’s modernist architecture will remind you of the marine world. Once inside Casa Batlló, we can immerse ourselves in the mind of Antoni Gaudí, probably Barcelona’s most important architect. As we walk through the different rooms of the house, we will discover how the Batlló family lived at the beginning of the 20th Century. We will walk through the main floor, where we can find the great hall with unique views of Passeig de Gràcia. We will pass through the main dining room and the modernist courtyard. Access the dragon’s rooftop through the inner courtyard, where the color blue dominates, and where looking through the glass will make you feel as if you are under the sea. On the rooftop we will marvel with the chimneys, where Gaudí considered even the smallest details and which are made using his quintessential technique, trencadís. Moreover, this rooftop is home of a dragon, will you be able to find it? In this incredible space of the Casa Batlló you will enjoy a short time to take photos and enjoy the views. At the end of the visit, you will have access to the Gaudí Cube, which will allow you to travel into Gaudí’s mind in a 360º experience. Head to Passeig de Gràcia 55 to enjoy an avant-garde space where art, technology and Catalan culture combine in a unique way. White Rabbit offers a unique immersive experience to discover authentic Catalan culture in Barcelona. Away from the typical tourist spots, this interactive tour connects you with local traditions through art, neighbourhood festivals, Gaudí's trencadís, Montjuïc fountains, Sant Joan fireworks and more. Let yourself be enveloped by the magic of Catalan traditions, as if you were in the middle of a vibrant correfoc, surrounded by sparks and drums, or in front of the hypnotic ou com balla. Immerse yourself in this cultural adventure in the heart of Barcelona.

activities.name: FREE Tour of Barcelona
activities.description: Barcelona has an irresistible creative energy: you feel it on the bustling streets and market squares, you see it in the incredible architecture and museums, you taste it in the fabulous food, and you live it in the legendary nightlife. Explore the lifestyle of the most exciting city on the Mediterranean with this 2½-hour walking tour. The incredible rich history and culture of Barcelona will be brought to life for you by the enthusiastic and knowledgeable independent local guides with whom we work. From Hercules, the legendary founder of the city, to Christopher Columbus; from Wilfred the Hairy, a heroic Catalan knight, to Pablo Picasso; Barcelona’s history is full of great adventurers, merchants, artists and warriors. The city has been shaped by many of the great seafaring civilizations of the Mediterranean. The sense of commerce, creativity and reaching for the horizon is what makes Barcelona such a unique place. Despite two millennia of proud history, for Barcelona the past is not enough. This is a city that is constantly reinventing itself to embrace the future. *Average tour length. The Barcelona Free Tour usually ends by the market of Santa Catarina. The independent guides with whom we work have your best interests in mind; while the tour usually includes the sites and stories above and lasts this long, your tour may vary depending on what your guide thinks is best for your group!

activities.name: Half Day Trip to Montserrat from Barcelona
activities.description: Discover the Magic of Montserrat: Half-Day Tours from Barcelona Escape the city and experience the spiritual beauty of Montserrat on one of our half-day tours from Barcelona. Ride up the mountain by Cremallera train or cable car and take in breathtaking views as you explore one of Catalonia’s most iconic landmarks. Whether you choose to visit in the morning or afternoon, both options include expert guides, a visit to the Black Madonna, and time to explore the dramatic landscape of Montserrat. Morning Tour: Guided Visit with Exclusive Access to the Black Madonna The morning Montserrat tour is perfect for travelers who want a deep dive into the culture and history of this sacred site. Travel comfortably from Barcelona and take the scenic Cremallera train up to the monastery. With your expert guide, explore the Montserrat Monastery, admire the fusion of Gothic and Renaissance architecture, and learn about the legend of the Virgin’s miraculous appearance. Enjoy exclusive access to the basilica and skip-the-line entry to the Black Madonna (La Moreneta), plus a tasting of local liqueurs and a visit to the audiovisual exhibition. You’ll also have free time to explore the surroundings, shop at the local market, or add optional experiences like hearing the world-renowned boys' choir or enjoying the immersive video mapping show. A special souvenir is included with your visit to La Moreneta. Afternoon Tour: Flexible Visit with Free Time to Explore For a more relaxed experience, the Montserrat afternoon tour offers flexibility and fewer crowds. Depart from Barcelona and choose between the Cremallera train or cable car ride up the mountain, both offering spectacular views. Once at the top, enjoy a guided introduction to the history and architecture of the monastery before skipping the line to visit the famous Black Madonna. You’ll also have time to wander the site at your own pace, take in panoramic viewpoints, and sample local products at the farmer’s market. This tour includes a tasting of typical Catalan liqueurs and access to the Montserrat audiovisual space—ideal for visitors who prefer a lighter itinerary without missing the essentials.

activities.name: Montserrat Monastery Visit & Local tasting from Barcelona
activities.description: Discover the Monastery of Montserrat on a half-day tour from Barcelona and learn about the cornerstone of Catalan culture. Enjoy Catalan pastries and liquors. DURATION 6 hours (Aprox.) ABOUT The experience starts in the upper part of Passeig de Gràcia, before journeying to experience the natural splendor of Montserrat, Catalonia’s most emblematic mountain. Topped by a Benedictine Monastery, Montserrat is an ideal half-day trip to spend a fun day in nature, just a few kilometers away from Barcelona. On the way to the Monastery, admire the Massif of Montserrat, a spectacular multi-peaked rocky range packed with unique needle-shape formations. Upon arrival, visit the Monastery, which was founded in the 10th century and still functions to this day, with over 70 monks. It is also well-known for hosting the figure of La Moreneta (visit not guaranteed) , who is the patron saint of Catalonia. Your guide will bring history alive by explaining the history of this Monastery dating nearly a thousand years, considered now the cornerstone of the Catalan culture, history, nature and spirituality. Finish this amazing guided visit tasting some of the most typical sweets and catalan pastries: garrapiñadas (caramelized nuts) and liquors made by the monks of the monastery. You will also have some free time before returning back to Barcelona. HIGHLIGHTS - Please, be at the check in point 15’ minutes before departure time. - Bring comfortable clothing and shoes - This product is subject to cancellation or rescheduling based on inclement weather. - The visit to the Moreneta is not guaranteed, it is subject to availability and depending on the season, as there may be up to 2hrs of queue. - There is a minimum of people required to operate the tour. In the event that this minimum is not met, customers will be offered an alternative date, another tour of equal or superior value, or a full refund. - There is a minimum number of people required to operate on languages that are not English or Spanish. If this minimum is not reached, the tour will be offered in English. - Tour may be affected due to special circumstances INCLUDES Guided visit of the Montserrat Monastery Multilingual Professional guide Taste typical catalan sweets and pastries: coca de Montserrat, garrapiñadas (caramelized nuts) and liquors made by the monks of the monastery Premium Small Group maximum capacity 18 people. NOT INCLUDED Tips (optional) Food or beverages Hotel pick up WHAT TO BRING Comfortable clothing and shoes

activities.name: Luis de Arquer: Solo Piano in Barcelona
activities.description: Solo Piano is the exquisite musical event offered at 'The World's Smallest Theater' in Barcelona. The pianist and composer Luis de Arquer plays Beethoven, Chopin, Mozart and improvisations and own compositions. The evening ends with the luxurious pleasure of a glass of champagne in the romantic candlelit garden.   Even the most demanding music lovers will be impressed by this lovely evening, of which the New York Times travel guide wrote, 'This may be your most charming musical evening in Barcelona.'

activities.name: Fast track La Pedrera guided tour
activities.description: We will start the guided tour of la Casa Milà by discovering its impressive stone façade. The undulation of the façade combined with the wrought iron railings will remind you a seabed full of seaweed. Did you know that la Casa Milà, also know as La Pedrera, is a UNESCO World Heritatge Site? We will have the opportunity to walk through the neighbors’ flat, which will be like a journey back in time. Your guide will explain how a bourgeois family lived there at the beginning of the 20th Century, as the house is completely decorated with furniture from the period. Look at all the details, as Gaudí considered even the design of the doorknobs. Discover the two interior courtyards of la Casa Milà: the “Patio de las Flores”, full of mural paintings that decorate this place, and the “Patio de las Mariposas”, where a butterfly is perfectly represented. Walk through the impressive attic, known as the “Whale Attic” because of its shape, which gives you the sensation of entering the interior of a large living being. Formed by more than 270 catenary arches, it will remind you the skeleton of a whale. We will not forget the Warriors’ Rooftop, from where you will have beautiful 360º views of Barcelona. The name of this rooftop is due to the chimneys, which represent the warriors and guardians of la Casa Milà.

activities.name: Barcelona: Wine & Cava with Tapas & 4WD Vineyards Experience
activities.description:
Enjoy an exclusive day out to a local winery in Penedes Region and taste 4 excellent wines and 4 glasses of cava paired with a wide variety of bytes & tapas. Drive through 2000 year-old vines accompanied by a local viticulturist in the vineyards to learn everything there is about wine-making! 4WD adventure around the vineyards included. And a professional oenologist into the cellars

Rates Adults (Note: From 9 years old): - €109.99 **Child & Infant: Not allowed.
Duration 6 hours
About Wine and gastronomy are part of Catalonia's popular wisdom. Through this tour, delve into the Penedès region to learn all about the fascinating world of wine. The influence of the sun and the Mediterranean Sea make the Penedès a privileged territory for winemaking. We will travel on a luxury private bus to visit 2 hand-picked selected wineries. Our first stop is a family-run boutique winery which has been cultivating vines for more than two thousand years. Upon arrival, you will be welcomed by an expert winemaker who will tell you about the history of this millenary winery and guide you into the subterranean wine cellar. In this remarkable space, learn fascinating facts about grape varieties, vine growing, wine making or the optimal conditions for its storage. It is now time to savor 4 charming wines in a stylish tasting room, accompanied by an assortment of gourmet delicatessen. Next, we will visit the traditional manor house (current residence of the owner family) and the vineyards to discover the art and secrets of winemaking! To add a glamorous touch to the experience, continue the visit through the vineyards on board of a convertible 4x4 car (approx. 40 min.) accompanied by your guide and a viticulturist, a true passionate expert! A unique and exclusive way to visit a stunning rural landscape with endless vineyards. Along the way, admire a Romanesque church settle among the vineyards and belonging to the manor. The second cellar visited is an equally historical winery specialized in cava, a naturally sparkling wine with an unmistakable flavor deeply rooted in Catalonia. An exclusive opportunity to enter the Capella, the heart of the cellar, being this the oldest part of the winery. An enchanting candle-lighted ancient room where time stands still. After visiting the vineyard and cellar, taste 4 unique cavas. These are also paired by a selection of appetizers to enhance the experience. Raise your glass for a toast to a great wine experience! Starting Point: Passatge de la Concepció, 7, 08008 Barcelona INCLUDES Visit of a local cava and wine family-run winery. Exclusive 4x4 ride along the vineyards with the local viticulturist. Private transport and specialized tour guide English and Spanish Bilingual tour -Wine and cava tour, tasting 4 wines and 4 cavas paired with a wide variety of bytes & tapas. NOT INCLUDED Tips (optional) Food or beverages Hotel pick up or transfer
What to Bring Comfortable clothing and shoes

Marvel at the iconic Roman aqueduct, explore the fairytale Alcázar, and wander through its winding streets filled with history. Next, head to Ávila, a UNESCO World Heritage city famed for its towering medieval walls. In the afternoon, continue to Toledo—once the capital of Spain and a place where Christian, Jewish, and Muslim cultures intertwine. Visit its iconic cathedral, a Gothic masterpiece and symbol of the city’s historical richness. As the sun sets, Toledo transforms. Golden lights illuminate ancient alleys, quiet plazas invite you to pause, and the rhythm of the city slows. Enjoy the evening at your leisure—perhaps with dinner in a traditional tavern, savoring regional flavors in an unforgettable setting. With the accommodation upgrade, spend the night at Eurostars Toledo, a modern 4-star hotel offering spacious rooms, excellent service, and a peaceful atmosphere—perfectly positioned to access the historic heart of the city. DAY 3: TOLEDO & MADRID Wake up in the heart of Toledo, where the early light casts a warm glow over ancient stone streets. After breakfast, enjoy a free morning to experience the city at your own rhythm. Whether you seek culture, calm, or light adventure, Toledo offers it all—take in views from the Mirador del Valle, relax in a quiet café, or rent an e-bike to explore the surrounding hills. In the early afternoon, meet your guide and leave the city behind for the peaceful landscapes of Castilla-La Mancha. Rolling hills and vineyards welcome you to a traditional boutique winery. Here, you’ll enjoy a guided walk through the vineyard and cellar, learning about the region’s unique winemaking heritage. The experience concludes with a tasting of three local wines—a perfect moment to slow down and savor. Afterwards, return to Madrid. With the accommodation upgrade, enjoy a return stay at H10 Tribeca, offering style, comfort, and great access to the city’s vibrant core. DAY 4: CÓRDOBA & MÁLAGA Start your day in Madrid and take a high-speed train to Córdoba for a day immersed in Andalusian history. Upon arrival, meet your expert guide for a cultural journey through this UNESCO World Heritage city, starting with its most iconic landmark: the Mezquita-Catedral. Inside, discover the fusion of Islamic and Christian architecture—striped arches, a magnificent mihrab, and a cathedral nave rising within a former mosque, all under one extraordinary roof. Then, stroll through the Jewish Quarter, a maze of narrow lanes, whitewashed houses, and hidden courtyards that tell stories of Córdoba’s rich, multicultural past. After the guided visit, enjoy free time to explore on your own, try local specialties like salmorejo, or relax in a sun-dappled plaza. In the late afternoon, continue south to Málaga, where the city welcomes you with its warm coastal light and Mediterranean energy. As night falls, take the opportunity to discover its vibrant old town, dine in a lively tapas bar, or enjoy a rooftop cocktail with sea breeze and skyline views—the perfect first taste of the Costa del Sol. With the accommodation upgrade, stay at NH Málaga, a stylish 4-star hotel ideally located between the historic center and the Guadalmedina River—offering modern comfort and direct access to the city’s cultural and gastronomic scene. DAY 5: MÁLAGA, RONDA, WHITE VILLAGES & SEVILLE Start your day with a guided journey through the heart of Andalusia, visiting three of its most iconic spots. Begin in Ronda, a dramatic mountaintop town known for the Puente Nuevo, sweeping views, and elegant old streets. Walk its scenic paths and explore the Moorish gardens of Alameda del Tajo. Continue through one of the region’s White Villages, where whitewashed houses, narrow lanes, and flower-filled balconies define the charm of rural Andalusia. Take time to explore, enjoy the views, and soak in the tranquil atmosphere. By afternoon, arrive in Seville, the soulful capital of the south. Take in the grandeur of Plaza de España, stroll the orange-scented streets of Santa Cruz, and admire exterior views of the Cathedral and Royal Alcázar. Seville by night invites you out—tapas bars, leafy patios, and the sound of flamenco create a perfect end to your day. With the accommodation upgrade, stay at H10 Corregidor Boutique Hotel, a stylish 4-star property built around a traditional Andalusian patio, ideally located in Seville’s Old Town. DAY 6: SEVILLE Enjoy your final morning in Seville with free time to explore at your own pace. Visit the Royal Alcázar, climb the Giralda tower, or step inside the Cathedral—one of the largest in the world. If you prefer to take it slow, stroll through María Luisa Park, browse artisan shops, or enjoy a relaxed lunch in a buzzing tapas bar. Seville invites you to savor every corner at your own rhythm. In the afternoon, join the Sevilla Tapas Delights Walking Tour & Flamenco Show. Your guide will lead you through picturesque streets, stopping at three selected venues to sample traditional and modern tapas, paired with local wines. The evening ends with a visit to an authentic tablao flamenco, where dancers, singers, and guitarists offer a passionate, soul-stirring performance—a powerful finale to your journey. With the accommodation upgrade, enjoy a second night at H10 Corregidor Boutique Hotel. DAY 7: BARCELONA Early in the morning, take a train to Barcelona. Once arrived, check in to your accommodation and enjoy some free time to explore the city at your own pace. Stroll down the elegant Passeig de Gràcia, admire the façades of Casa Batlló and La Pedrera, or lose yourself in the Gothic Quarter. If you prefer to unwind, Barceloneta beach offers the perfect spot to relax by the sea. In the afternoon, your private journey officially begins with the Barcelona Best Walking Tour. Led by a local expert, this immersive experience takes you through the city’s historic heart before culminating in a guided visit to the Sagrada Familia—Gaudí’s awe-inspiring masterpiece. With fast-track access, step inside this architectural wonder and discover the rich symbolism and visionary design that make it one of the most iconic buildings in the world. As the sun sets, treat yourself to a rooftop drink with views over the city or enjoy a Mediterranean dinner in the atmospheric Born district. If you selected the accommodation upgrade, enjoy a stay at H10 Urquinaona Plaza, a 4-star boutique hotel housed in a restored 19th-century building just steps from Plaça Catalunya. DAY 8: MONTSERRAT & GIRONA Begin the day with a visit to Montserrat, Catalonia’s sacred mountain. Its dramatic, jagged peaks set the stage for a deeply atmospheric experience. Visit the Benedictine monastery and see the Black Madonna—La Moreneta, a symbol of devotion for centuries. Your guide will lead you through the basilica, cloister, and main square, combining history, spirituality, and breathtaking views. In the afternoon, continue to Girona, one of Spain’s most beautiful medieval cities. Upon arrival, enjoy a guided walking tour through its Gothic cathedral, Jewish Quarter, Eiffel bridge, and ancient city walls. Rather than returning to Barcelona, you’ll stay the night—because Girona after dark is truly special. As day visitors leave, the city transforms: locals fill the terraces, the Onyar River glows under warm streetlights, and the air is filled with history, music, and the aromas of Catalan cuisine. If you select the accommodation upgrade, you’ll stay at the DoubleTree by Hilton Girona, a contemporary hotel just a short walk from the historic center. DAY 9: GIRONA & COSTA BRAVA After a relaxed breakfast at your hotel, enjoy the morning to discover Girona at your own pace. Dive deeper into its charm—visit the Jewish History Museum, browse artisan shops, or enjoy a classic vermut in one of the hidden squares of the Old Town. You’ll also have time to enjoy lunch in one of Girona’s excellent local restaurants, where Catalan cuisine blends tradition with creativity. Around mid-afternoon, your journey continues to the Costa Brava, where you’ll discover Tossa de Mar, one of its most enchanting seaside towns. Walk along the medieval castle walls—the only ones by the sea in Catalonia—with stunning views over the bay. Tossa is more than a beach town—it embodies the wild coastline, Mediterranean charm, and timeless beauty of the Costa Brava. In the evening, return to Barcelona. With the accommodation upgrade, enjoy a second night at H10 Urquinaona Plaza, your elegant retreat in the heart of the city. DAY 10: BARCELONA On your final day, enjoy the freedom to explore Barcelona at your own rhythm before heading home. highlights: • Exclusive experiences across Spain’s most iconic regions • Guided tours in each location • Discover the rich history, vibrant culture, and diverse gastronomy in each location • Comfortable travel in a small group with expert local guide • Optional premium hotel package in each destination with carefully selected 4-star stays check_in_details: • Please, be at the check in point 15’ minutes before departure time. • This product is subject to cancellation or rescheduling based on inclement weather.

activities.name: Rooster & Bubbles - París
activities.shortDescription: The booking conditions will be displayed in the booking step
activities.description:
- Rooster & Bubbles es un restaurante que revive la tradición barcelonesa del pollo a l'ast, popularizada en los años 60 por Joan Casas, fundador del emblemático Kikiriki. Marc Martínez, su nieto, ha modernizado esta tradición en un espacio contemporáneo en el barrio del Born.
La propuesta gastronómica incluye carnes de proximidad cocinadas a l'ast, como pollo, cerdo y cordero, servidas en diversas opciones: al plato, en sándwiches o ensaladas. Entre las especialidades destacan el combo de pollo a l'ast entero, el plato mixto de carnes a l'ast y el canelón de pollo a l'ast.
El restaurante también ofrece una variedad de tapas para compartir, como fingers de pollo, croquetas de pollo a l'ast y patatas bravas con alioli. Los postres artesanales incluyen crema catalana, tarta cremosa de queso y helado de avellana artesanal.
El ambiente del restaurante es acogedor, con una decoración que combina elementos modernos y tradicionales. Es ideal para disfrutar de una comida en pareja, amigos...

activities.name: Horseback riding in Montserrat, Barcelona
activities.shortDescription: Enjoy a horseback ride in Montserrat National Park and travel back to the 11th century exploring Montserrat Abbey.
activities.description:
Enjoy a horseback ride in Montserrat National Park and travel back to the 11th century exploring Montserrat Abbey.

A 1 hour drive from Barcelona you will find Montserrat, the most important and significant mountain in Catalonia, known for its many peaks. Due to its curious shape, it is called "Serrated Mountain" in Catalan. In Montserrat you can also discover the Monastery of Santa Maria de Montserrat built in the 11th century where an image of the Virgin of Montserrat with miraculous powers is kept. Thousands of tourists and pilgrims visit the monastery to pray to the virgin and enjoy the views that the mountain offers over the region.

On this horseback riding tour in Montserrat, Tours by Uni's instructors will guide you on this horseback riding tour. You will be picked up in Barcelona and taken to the trails of Montserrat National Park for a scenic 50 minute ride. You will start by visiting the Abbey of Montserrat admiring its Romanesque, Gothic and Renaissance architecture nestled on the mountainside where you will find La Moreneta, the patron saint of Catalonia. You will have some free time before your horseback riding tour of Montserrat to enjoy the local farmers' market and discover the local produce. You will then arrive at the ranch where you will meet the horse on which you will enjoy this horseback riding tour in Montserrat. There you will enjoy riding through the countryside of Montserrat National Park, ending with the route of the three Romanesque hermitages discovering the landscapes of a jagged and saw-toothed mountain range. Before returning to the meeting point in Barcelona you can enjoy some free time to relax at the ranch.

Discover the wonders of Barcelona with this horseback riding tour of Montserrat, discovering its rugged rock formations and jagged peaks rising above the surrounding landscape.

activities.name: Snowshoeing Tour through Rasos de Peguera, Catalan Pyrenees
activities.shortDescription: Come and go on a snowshoeing tour in Rasos de Peguera, in the Catalan Pyrenees and discover one of the best winter sports!
activities.description:
Come and go on a snowshoeing tour in Rasos de Peguera, in the Catalan Pyrenees and discover one of the best winter sports!

Just an hour and a half from Barcelona, you will find Rasos de Peguera, a ski resort at an altitude of 1836 metres in the pre-Pyrenean area of the Catalan Pyrenees, perfect both for those who want to start skiing and for those who enjoy hiking with snowshoes through the snowy forests of the Pyrenees.

Ski rackets or snowshoes are the ideal sport for those addicted to hiking, as these snowshoes allow you to make routes through the forest without the snow being a problem by distributing your weight over the snow. You'll feel like you're floating on the snowshoe while moving more comfortably and quickly. The instructors of SM Experiences will guide you on this route with ski rackets through Rasos de Peguera of about 6-7 kilometres and 3 hours of duration. This is an easy excursion with a difference in altitude of about 300 metres where the instructor will guide you on a private excursion. In addition, the instructors will provide you with all the material and will pick you up from your hotel, so all you need to bring is your hiking skills and winter mountain clothes.

Ready to get your snowshoes on in the Catalan Pyrenees? Book now!

activities.name: Horse riding excursion to the Monastery of Montserrat from Barcelona
activities.shortDescription: Discover the Monastery of Monserrat with this horse riding experience. Enjoy this incredible activity with your family, friends or partner near to Barcelona.
activities.description:
Discover the Monastery of Monserrat with this horseback riding experience. Enjoy this amazing activity with your family, friends or partner near Barcelona.

Explore a memorable day in Montserrat and escape the noise of the city of Barcelona with this horseback riding experience in the Natural Park. Be amazed by the breathtaking views while you live a unique experience and learn the basics of horse riding. Have fun and feel unique in your experience in a small group Premium excursion.

Half-day excursion (5,5h) to the most emblematic mountain in Catalonia crowned by a Benedictine monastery, Montserrat is an ideal excursion to spend a fun day in nature, just a few kilometres from Barcelona. Led by experienced guides, the route is suitable for all ages. Enjoy the ride and the spectacular views of the mountain without worrying about your previous riding level.

On the way to the monastery, admire the Montserrat Massif, a spectacular rocky mountain range with multiple peaks full of unique needle-like formations. Upon arrival, visit the monastery, which was founded in the 10th century and is still in operation today, with more than 70 monks. It is also known for housing the figure of the Moreneta (visit not guaranteed), who is the patron saint of Catalonia.

During the visit, you will have free time for souvenir shopping and photo opportunities. Get ready for an exciting horseback ride through the Natural Park, which offers breathtaking views of Montserrat. All this while enjoying the freedom and tranquillity of the countryside.

activities.name: Casa Batlló: Entry Ticket
activities.shortDescription: Visit the magical world of Casa Batlló
activities.description:
Casa Batlló's nature-inspired facade, brilliant colors, and thought-provoking whimsical features make it one of Gaudí's most popular masterpieces. With these Casa Batlló tickets, you'll enjoy admission to Casa Batlló, including a SmartGuide. 

The SmartGuides are the museum’s innovative way to explore Casa Batlló! These nifty gadgets combine an audio guide with augmented reality technology, so you can explore and watch the house come to life around you. A guide is included with every entry ticket.

Sample a variety of tapas, including sardines and croquettes, as you explore the city's flavors. 

Follow a local guide through different neighborhoods, learning about the area's history and culture. This tour offers both food and cultural highlights of Barcelona, perfect for those interested in local cuisine and culture.

activities.shortDescription: Enjoy an easy transfer to visit sandy beaches
activities.description:
Use the SARFA bus line to travel directly from Barcelona airport or the city center to Lloret de Mar. The trip takes approximately 2 hours from Barcelona El Prat airport.

Travel comfortably on modern buses offering reliable service in the Costa Brava area. Operating since 1921, SARFA provides fast and safe transportation.

activities.name: White Rabbit of Barcelona: Entry Ticket
activities.shortDescription: Discover Barcelona's culture through a mix of art and technology
activities.description:
Experience Catalan culture at White Rabbit, an immersive attraction connecting you with local Barcelona traditions. Explore a side of the city known mainly to residents, perfect for those who want more than typical tourist spots. Local artists showcase Barcelona’s traditions in 10 distinct rooms.

Begin by exploring neighborhood festivals and enjoy a 360º view of Gaudí’s trencadís mosaics and Montjuïc’s fountains, dancing at Razzmatazz, and a VR experience reimagining Catalan myths and legends. At the museum, see immersive art and playful installations.

Starting at White Rabbit will deepen your understanding of local culture and enrich your city visit. It's an ideal first stop for anyone seeking an authentic taste of Barcelona. On Passeig de Gràcia 55, just a 2-minute walk from Casa Batlló, engage with Catalan culture through art and interactive installations.

activities.description:

This funicular replaces the historic Funicular del Tibidabo. It stands out for its efficiency and sustainability, using advanced technology for a safe and eco-friendly trip. This is a great way to start a visit to one of the most well-known places in the city.

activities.name: Barcelona: Wine Gogh Glow Academy Paint & Wine Workshop
activities.description:
Unleash the inner Picasso with the "Wine and Gogh" painting experience! It's the perfect social activity for those who love blending their artistic creativity with a friendly, laid-back atmosphere. Participants get to paint under the expert tutelage of an instructor, all while sipping on a glass of fine wine, making for a socially engaging and uninhibited experience.

What sets this version of "Wine and Gogh" apart is the use of fluorescent paint. This type of paint glows under ultraviolet lights, introducing a vibrant and magical twist to artistic creation. As the night progresses, the artwork comes alive with bright colors and unique luminescent effects.

The event's structure ensures that attendees learn basic painting techniques while having a blast. With no prior experience required, this activity is accessible to all - from beginners to seasoned painters looking to experiment with new mediums. Book now for a night of wine, fun, and creativity!

activities.name: Tibidabo Funicular: Cuca de Llum Roundtrip Ride
activities.description:
Ride Cuca de Llum, the modern funicular that connects the base of Tibidabo Amusement Park to its summit. This transport offers convenient and quick transit. With a modern design and large windows, passengers get views of Barcelona.

This funicular replaces the historic Funicular del Tibidabo. It stands out for its efficiency and sustainability, using advanced technology for a safe and eco-friendly trip. This is a great way to start a visit to one of the most well-known places in the city.

activities.name: Early Morning Casa Batlló VIP Guided Tour With Breakfast
activities.description: Start your day with our exclusive first-access guided tour of Casa Batlló, Antoni Gaudí's masterpiece in Barcelona. As the first visitors of the day, you’ll have the chance to snap incredible, crowd-free photos of this architectural wonder.The tour begins in the Gaudí Dôme, an immersive art installation that sets the stage for the magic to come. With over 1,000 screens, this dimly lit space brings to life the natural world that inspired the architect's vision.As your pro guide takes you through the house, you’ll discover the secrets hidden within its unusual, fluid walls. Admire the stained-glass, freeform shapes, and mosaics that Gaudí is famous for.The tour finishes on the rooftop, where you can take in amazing panoramic views of Barcelona.Afterward, you'll head to the cafeteria of Casa Amatller. Here, you’ll enjoy a delicious pastry breakfast with a chocolatey drink, served in the original kitchen of what was once home to Barcelona’s most famous chocolatier.

activities.name: Tour to Girona, Figueres and Cadaqués from Barcelona
activities.description: Set out on an incredible journey to discover three of Catalonia's most iconic destinations, all in one day from Barcelona. This day trip seamlessly blends history, art, and nature, offering a true taste of Catalonia's cultural and scenic treasures.Begin in the historic city of Girona, where centuries of history come alive as you stroll through its beautifully preserved medieval streets. Cross the colorful Eiffel Bridge, admire the grandeur of the Cathedral, and immerse yourself in the city's rich blend of Roman, Gothic, and contemporary architecture. Girona's charm and its stunning old town will transport you to another era.Next, venture to Figueres, the birthplace of Salvador Dalí and home to the remarkable Dalí Theatre-Museum. This world-renowned museum is a testament to Dalí's brilliance and creativity, showcasing his surrealist masterpieces and offering an intimate glimpse into his artistic vision. Every corner of the museum reflects his eccentric genius, making it an unmissable experience for art enthusiasts and curious minds alike.Conclude your day in the idyllic coastal town of Cadaqués, a haven of natural beauty and inspiration for countless artists, including Dalí himself. Wander its narrow, whitewashed streets, relax on pristine beaches, and marvel at the turquoise waters of the Mediterranean. Located in the heart of the Cap de Creus Natural Park, Cadaqués provides a serene and picturesque backdrop to end your adventure.

activities.name: Casa Batlló Gold Tickets
activities.description: Casa Batlló is one of the most famous buildings in the heart of Barcelona built between 1904 and 1906. It was commissioned to Antoni Gaudí by a Spanish entrepreneur, Josep Batlló. This UNESCO World Heritage site is one of the architect’s masterpieces of the city, along with the Sagrada Familia. As well as a magnificent example of Catalan Modernist architecture, it is considered worldwide as an artistic chef d’oeuvre.Enjoy Casa Batlló's new tour of the astonishing Gaudí masterpiece, with two all-new innovative spaces, technological installations and intelligent devices. Discover this UNESCO World Heritage Site and start your journey into the genius’s mind in the amazing Gaudí Dome and Gaudí Cube.

activities.name: Casa Batlló self-guided audio tour
activities.description: Explore Casa Batlló in Barcelona at your own pace and learn all you need to know about one of Gaudi's most famous architectural masterpieces thanks to a multimedia tour app on your smartphone. Self-guide through this unmistakable building following detailed audio commentaries recorded in your own language - sightseeing has never been easier!This audio tour allows you to visit one of Antoni Gaudi's most treasured creations without missing anything. Listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 2005, Casa Batlló has since attracted millions of visitors who come here to admire its unique facade and discover its fascinating story. Today, it is one of the most visited venues in the city and a true icon of Barcelona.

activities.name: In-app self-guided audio tour to discover the Catalan capital
activities.description: Start your walk at Paseo de Gracia, where the city’s turn-of-the-century bourgeoise built its mesmerizing palaces. See some of the iconic Modernist works located here including Antoni Gaudi’s masterpieces – Casa Milà and Casa Batlló. Get to Plaça de Catalunya and see where the old historical quarter of the city meets with the 19th-century new district. Stroll to the oldest square of Barcelona, amusingly called Plaça Nova (New Square). Trace the history of the Catalan capital from the times of the Roman Empire to the Middle Ages and the present day.Admire the Gothic Cathedral representing the heart of the colorful city. Feel the spirit of the proud people of Catalonia and get to know the region’s rich cultural traditions. Examine the Renaissance façade of the Catalan Government Palace, one of the few medieval buildings in Europe that still functions as a seat of government. Learn more about Catalan national identity, its symbols and its heroes. Take a walk along La Rambla Street – the famous pedestrian boulevard in the center of Barcelona. Finish the tour at the Columbus Monument – the monument to the discoverer of the New World erected in memory of the end of his first trip to the new continent.

activities.name: Tickets to the Egyptian Museum of Barcelona
activities.description: The Egyptian Museum of Barcelona (Fundació Arqueològica Clos - Museu Egipci de Barcelona) is one of Europe's foremost private collections of Egyptian art and culture, and an organization committed to research, study and dissemination of Ancient Egypt.Booking your ticket in advance will let you skip the line and start your visit to the museum as soon as you arrive.The museum runs guided tours of its collections led by Egyptologists, which are essential in giving visitors a greater knowledge of Egyptian culture and civilization. More than 2.000 square meters of gallery space showcase almost one thousand exhibits, including sarcophagi, mummies, jewelry and amulets, to give you a greater understanding of everyday life and prevailing customs of the ancient civilization of the Pharaohs. In addition to permanent collections and temporary exhibitions, the museum also organizes other activities that enable visitors to enjoy the collections in an entertaining, fun way. These activities include night-time guided tours featuring re-enactments of scenes by actors. Another activity is the "Eternal Banquet", a guided tour centering on Egyptian cuisine, which gives visitors the opportunity to taste products that were part of the diet of this ancient civilization.

activities.name: Casa Batlló Blue Tickets
activities.description: Casa Batlló is one of Barcelona's most emblematic modernist buildings and one of the most highly rated cultural and tourist attractions, welcoming 1 million visitors every year. This masterpiece is known as the Casa dels Ossos or House of Bones because of the skeletal shapes that make up its facade and it is considered as one of the most creative and original jobs of the architect.Enter the world of Antonio Gaudí and discover this gem, a UNESCO World Heritage site. Enjoy an immersive experience thanks to the intelligent audio guide. Admire all of the magic surrounding Casa Batlló and discover a legend of architecture and design.Enjoy Casa Batlló's new tour of the astonishing Gaudí masterpiece, with two all-new innovative spaces, technological installations and intelligent devices. Discover this UNESCO World Heritage Site and start your journey into the genius’s mind in the amazing Gaudí Cube.

activities.name: White Rabbit. Catalonia’s Top Immersive Art Experience
activities.description: Discover authentic Catalan culture at White Rabbit, a unique immersive experience that connects you with Barcelona’s local traditions known only by its residents. Take an unconventional journey through the most genuine side of Barcelona, ideal for those seeking original experiences beyond typical tourist spots.Begin your adventure by immersing yourself in the vibrant streets of neighbourhood festivals, dive into a 360º visual explosion of Gaudí’s mosaic trencadís and the magical waters of Montjuïc's fountains. Dance like you're at the city’s most famous nightclub and step into a room filled with fireworks, just like on the nights of Sant Joan. These and many more interactive experiences await you at the museum!You'll never be asked to stay quiet, you’re free to touch everything, and take all the flash photos you want!If you start your journey in Barcelona at White Rabbit, you’ll gain a true understanding of local culture and be able to enjoy everything the city has to offer even more. It’s the perfect starting point for those looking for an authentic experience in Barcelona, diving into what truly makes the city special.Enjoy immersive art, interact with installations, and experience Catalan culture in a completely new way!

activities.name: Casa Batlló 'A Winter Night' Experience
activities.description: "A Winter Night" offers you an intimate visit to Casa Batlló. Discover the most iconic spaces of the house through the people who lived in it, in a unique scenography that will touch your emotions.Follow the voice of Juan Carlos, the great-grandson of the Batlló family who lived in the house for years. A perfect guide to immerse us in life inside the building in the first person.Original soundtrack composed by Jordi Longán, with the special collaboration of Sheila Blanco on the main song about Fermina, the legendary housekeeper of Casa Batlló.Starting on November 17th, coinciding with the opening of "A Winter's Night" and throughout the Christmas season, the façade of Casa Batlló will be illuminated for the occasion.

activities.name: Barcelona: Casa Batllo Timed Entrance Ticket with Audio Guide
activities.description: Antoni Gaudí, one of Spain’s most prolific architects and designers, left his mark on buildings across the city. Explore Casa Batllo, viewed by many as one of Gaudi’s most important masterpieces, with an audio guide on this self-guided tour that features a timed entrance ticket to help ensure your visit goes smoothly.

activities.name: Penedes and Cava Winery Small-Group Tour
activities.description: Visit the cava wineries of Penedes with a local guide and a small group of fellow tourists on this half-day tour from Barcelona. You'll visit a family-run cellar dating to the 14th century, where you'll learn about the history of cava production and get a chance to sample organic cava, paired with tapas.

activities.name: Luxury Tour in Cadaqués and Lunch from Barcelona
activities.description:
Discover the charming village of Cadaqués on a day trip from Barcelona. Enjoy a wine tasting with privileged sea views, savor a delicious lunch in a local restaurant.

Taste the flavors of the Mediterranean with a first-class lunch at a local restaurant

Discover the creative essence of Salvador Dali with a visit to his house-museum

Enjoy a wine tasting with privileged sea views in the charming village

Enjoy a first-class lunch

Enjoy your excursion aboard a premium vehicle

activities.name: 60 min Thai & Bali Massage at THAI SPA MASSAGE BARCELONA
activities.description: To be able to enjoy a fusion fusion, Thai - Balinese made by one of our professional Thai masseurs in the middle of Passeig de Gracia in Barcelona, without having to travel to Thailand. At the end we will offer you a tea, water or fruit juice

activities.name: Casa Batlló Admission Ticket: 10D Experience
activities.description:
Arrive at Gaudí's Casa Batlló in Barcelona with your voucher, also available on your mobile device for extra convenience, and head inside. Pick up your included audio guide which walks you through this spectacular example of Gaudí's architectural style. 

The audio guide takes you through the museum's five distinct areas, such as the Noble floor, where the Batlló family once lived. Head up to the loft, which acted as a laundry room and cupboard, from which you can access the roof terrace. See the unusual chimneys and "Dragon Back" a model that depicts the dragon slain by St. George. As you wander around, notice the artist and architect's meticulous attention to detail in the door handles, skylights, and banisters. 

End up in the home's entrance hall, dominated by a dramatic staircase made to look like the spine of a huge animal. After your guided audio tour is finished, you are free to stay as long as you like.

activities.name: Barcelona: Montserrat Monastery and Hiking Tour
activities.description: Montserrat Monastery—atop the Montserrat Mountains—is a popular tourist spot, meaning it can get pretty busy. On this full-day small-group tour, spend your time exploring rather than waiting with skip-the-line tickets. Ride the funicular cable railway up the mountain before heading for a hike through the Montserrat Natural Park, taking in the region’s striking rock formations.

activities.name: Barcelona Casa Batllo Gold Package With Cube and Dome
activities.description: Enjoy an immersive experience at Antoni Gaudí’s masterpiece, Casa Batlló by booking your premium gold tour package. Guarantee your entry and skip the line with fast-track admission, then explore the modernist architectural gem with the 10D sensory tour, with enriching commentary and music by the Berlin Philharmonic Orchestra. Includes access to th Gaudí Dome and Gaudí Cube.

activities.name: Costa Brava Easy Hike and Girona Small-Group from Barcelona
activities.description: Go hiking in Costa Brava, then visit the medieval town of Girona during this full-day tour from Barcelona. Following your local guide, enjoy an easy walk on the coastal trail, discovering fishing villages and secluded beaches as you walk. Eat lunch in Girona (own expense), then set out to see the sights of this medieval city, including the Cathedral and one of the best-preserved Jewish quarters in Europe.

activities.name: Kayak and trekking through the wonderful Costa Brava
activities.description: Escape the crowds of central Barcelona with this scenic, combined trekking and kayaking trip along the picturesque Costa Brava coastline. Accompanied by your guide—and a maximum of ten other travelers—enjoy spectacular scenery as you hike part of the Camino de Ronda, before taking to the water for a spot of kayaking. Your guide will also recommend where to try a traditional Spanish paella.

activities.name: 60 min Foot and Leg Massage at THAI SPA MASSAGE BARCELONA
activities.description: Being able to enjoy a Thai foot and leg massage in a comfortable chair, performed by one of our professional Thai masseurs in the heart of Passeig de Gracia in Barcelona, without having to travel to Thailand. At the end we will offer you a tea, water or fruit juice

activities.name: Barcelona Party With Beer Pong Drinking Game Plus VIP Club Entry
activities.description:
Highlight

Karaoke Night(weekend)

Beer Pong + Drinking Game

VIP entrance to the club and skip the line

Explore Barcelona's most famous nightlife districts

One time you buy a ticket, you can join us for the other nights for FREE

activities.name: Barcelona Luggage Storage in Plaza Catalunya
activities.description: Experience the freedom of exploring without the extra weighting in Barcelona. Our luggage storage service ensures your belongings are secure, allowing you to enjoy the wonders of your destination with peace of mind. Whether you're waiting for a late flight, have arrived early for your stay, or simply want to explore without the burden of your bags, our service is the perfect solution. Store your bags at prime locations near major attractions, transport hubs, and popular areas, making your travel experience smoother and more enjoyable.

activities.name: Barcelona to Montseny Full-Day Small-Group Hiking Tour, Lunch
activities.description: Escape the ‘urban jungle of Barcelona for a laid-back, 8.5-hour hiking trip with a small group set amidst the scenery of Montseny Nature Reserve. Wander along the leafy trails of this protected area with no more than 8 guests, passing picturesque mountains and a historic romanesque shrine as you walk. As you continue, you’ll also visit a beloved Holm Oak tree and explore the rustic country homes of local inhabitants. An included ‘eco-friendly’ lunch of locally-sourced foodstuffs and wine caps off the experience. A guide and private vehicle transport are also included.

activities.name: Sagrada Familia & La Pedrera Small Group Tour with Cava Tasting
activities.description:
Explore Gaudí’s architectural gems on this small-group walking tour in Barcelona. This journey includes an expert-guided visit of the Sagrada Familia and La Pedrera (Casa Mila), two of Gaudí’s most iconic works.

At La Pedrera, marvel at the whimsical architecture and enjoy panoramic rooftop views. The experience culminates with a cava tasting.

Wander through the Eixample district, capturing the essence of Barcelona’s urban evolution.

Delve into the intricacies of Sagrada Familia’s facades and interiors, where each detail tells a story.

activities.name: La Pedrera - Casa Mila Sunrise: Early Morning Access
activities.description:
Early in the morning, make your own way to La Pedrera –Casa Milà, located on the Passeig de Gracia in central Barcelona. Meet your guide and small group, and head right in with your exclusive early-morning access pass.

Embark on your tour of the UNESCO-listed apartments, designed by legendary Catalonian architect Antoni Gaudi. Observe a recreation of a bourgeois family's home life in the Pedrera Apartment; ascend to the roof to admire the notable corkscrew chimneys; and check out exhibits on the life and work of Gaudi.

activities.name: Barcelona Small-Group LGBTQ Nightlife Bar Crawl in Gaixample
activities.description: Experience Barcelona’s vibrant LGBTQ culture on this small-group bar crawl through Gaixample. It can be difficult for first-time visitors to navigate the city’s queer scene, so this small-group experience guides you directly to the best spots. Connect with locals and fellow travelers over cocktails, experience a drag show, and finish the evening at a disco-themed club.

activities.name: Gaudí and Barcelona Legends Walking Tour
activities.description: Discover the unique history and legends that surround the Spanish city of Barcelona during this walking tour through Passeig de Gracia and the El Born district. Listen to engaging commentary about Catalonia’s rich history from medieval times to today; see where Antoni Gaudi got his inspiration for his famous buildings; and admire examples of modernist architecture including Casa Mila and Palau de la Musica Catalana.

activities.name: La Pedrera Guided Tour with Fast Track Access
activities.description:
Embark on a captivating exploration of Casa Mila, a masterpiece by Gaudi, on our guided tour. The undulating stone façade, reminiscent of a vibrant seabed, sets the stage for a journey through time and architectural genius.

Step inside a meticulously recreated neighbor's flat, furnished in period style, and transport yourself to Barcelona's early 20th century. Observe intricate details, from ornate doorknobs to Gaudi's signature touch in every corner.

Immerse yourself in the serenity of Mila's two courtyards. The "Patio de las Flores" blooms with vibrant murals, while the "Patio de las Mariposas" delicately showcases a butterfly motif.

Finally, crown your experience on the panoramic "Warriors' Rooftop," aptly named for its chimney sentinels guarding the city. From here, breathtaking 360° views of Barcelona unfold before you, a fitting finale to an unforgettable journey.

activities.name: Montserrat Monastery Small Group Tour and Hiking Experience
activities.description: Explore the majestic Natural Park of Montserrat on a small-group tour and hike, ascending the mountain for breathtaking views. Visit the Basilica of Santa Maria de Montserrat and learn about the monks' daily life. Trek ancient pilgrimage paths, discovering diverse flora and fauna, and savor panoramic vistas. Afterward, enjoy free time to explore the monastery, taste local specialties, and shop before returning to Barcelona.

activities.name: Spain, France, and Andorra Private Day Tour from Barcelona
activities.description: Escape busy Barcelona and let a private driver show you Spain, France, and Andorra in just one day in this fully customizable tour. Visit only the attractions you’re interested in from the comfort of a private car. Your driver can provide you with some historical information and their local perspective.

activities.name: Barcelona Private Car Tour with Hidden Gems and Landmarks
activities.description:
Discover Barcelona like a local on a private 3-hour car tour tailored for small groups of up to 3 people. Ideal for families or friends, this experience combines iconic landmarks with hidden gems, avoiding crowds for a truly unique perspective.

Starting from your hotel or a central location, the journey begins along the elegant Paseo de Gracia. Marvel at Gaudí’s Casa Batlló and La Pedrera, two Modernist masterpieces showcasing the city’s architectural splendor.

Continue to Plaza d’Espanya, featuring the Venetian Towers and the Magic Fountain, then ascend Montjuïc Hill. Enjoy highlights like the MNAC, the Olympic Stadium, and the Mirador de Montjuïc for breathtaking city and sea views.

Descend to Barceloneta and Port Olímpic, embracing Barcelona’s coastal charm. Conclude with a drive by the Sagrada Familia, Gaudí’s awe-inspiring basilica. Your guide offers insider stories, ensuring a memorable adventure.

activities.name: Costa Brava Scenic Hike & Tossa de Mar Small Group Tour
activities.description: See an ancient medieval town by the sea during this guided, full-day hike around Brava Coast with an included 3-course lunch. With the Mediterranean Sea in the backdrop, take the costal path along coves stopping to swim. In Tossa de Mar, enjoy a guided tour, traditional Catalan lunch, and wander around an ancient fisherman's village

activities.name: White Rabbit · The Off‑Museum of Barcelona Entry Ticket
activities.description:
10 artist-designed immersive installations – interactive sets celebrating Catalan traditions like capgrossos (giant heads), caganers, castellers, and correfocs with artistic reinterpretation

VR myth experiences & mirrored infinity room – step into dragon battles, fire runs, and a kaleidoscopic Gaudí-inspired mosaic cube

Interactive dance and projection areas – dance in a silent disco and see your movements projected into evolving visual artworks

Cultural storytelling through art & humor – playful installations redefine local symbols like festivals and folklore with contemporary relevance

Flexible and Independent Experience – Perfect for travelers who prefer freedom over group tours.

It is not possible to skip the security lines. There could be a line at the entrance and is mandatory for all visitors.

activities.name: Private Tour Best of Barcelona: Sagrada Familia and Old Town
activities.description:
Experience our Private Excursion tailored exclusively for you!

Embark on a serene journey through the picturesque landscapes of Spain as you make your way to the heart of the city. Upon your arrival, meet your seasoned tour guide, ready to lead you on an enchanting tour of Barcelona.

Discover the awe-inspiring allure of Sagrada Familia, marvel at the grandeur of Old Town, and capture iconic moments at landmarks like Parc de Montjuic, Port Vell, Ciutat Vella and many more.

Our excursions are meticulously designed schedule.

We'll greet you directly at the hotel and ensure you return with ample time to relax and relish your day.

Leave the details to us as we escort you on an extraordinary adventure, crafting memories that will stand the test of time!

activities.name: Barcelona Small-Group La Pedrera Tour with Casa Batlló Option
activities.description: Discover one of Antoni Gaudí's masterpieces, La Pedrera, or Casa Milà, on this small-group guided morning tour. Save time with priority entrance and discover the site with the benefit of a guide. Then stroll along the Passeig de Gracia to see Casa Amatller and Casa Batlló, with the option to add skip-the-line entrance for Casa Batlló as well.

activities.name: Gaudí and Modernistas 8-Hour Private Tour
activities.description:
Immerse yourself in Catalan modernism with this exclusive 8-hour tour of Barcelona. From the iconic Casa Milà to the majestic Sagrada Familia, discover the architectural legacy of Antoni Gaudí while enjoying the vibrant culture of the city.

Sagrada Familia ticket guarantee. Booking with real availability

Admire the uniqueness of La Pedrera, with its undulating facade and sculptural fireplaces.

Explore the colorful and charming Park Güell with unparalleled panoramic views.

Visit the imposing Sagrada Familia and climb its towers for an unforgettable view of Barcelona.

activities.name: Private Shopping Tour from Barcelona Hotels to La Roca Village
activities.description:
Comfortable roundtrip transportation from your hotel in Barcelona to La Roca Shopping Village in Barcelona plays host to over 120 luxury boutiques and stores selling everything from clothes and accessories to cosmetics and home essentials. Its world-class boutiques, showcasing collections from prestigious local and international designers, make for a truly memorable shopping experience. Add to all these unbeatable prices and a handful of trendy cafés and restaurants, and what you’ll get is one of the best shopping destinations in and around Barcelona. After you finish your shopping, you will be picked up and delivered directly to your hotel in Barcelona.

All our vehicles are fully licensed and insured. We are happy to provide child seats in our cars for all ages upon request. Vehicles are clean inside and out; our drivers are well-dressed and unfailingly attentive to our guests. They speak English. They will greet you with a name sign and help with luggage.

activities.name: Gaudi in One Day: Sagrada Familia, Park Guell, La Pedrera & Tapas
activities.description:
In just one day, experience the best of Gaudi: capture the colorful facade of Casa Batllo, step inside Casa Mila (La Pedrera) to admire its rooftop chimneys and views, explore the vibrant mosaics of Park Guell, savor traditional Catalan tapas, and be amazed by the outstanding forest-like interior of La Sagrada Familia.

Discover the essence of Barcelona through the genius of Antoni Gaudi, whose work has shaped the city’s identity like no other. This carefully designed tour invites you to explore his most celebrated creations while uncovering the stories, ideas, and inspirations behind them.

activities.name: Gaudí Houses Tour with Casa Batlló, Casa Milà and Casa Vicens
activities.description:
Get ready to immerse yourself in the whimsical world of Antoni Gaudí! On this adventure, you’ll discover three of his most iconic masterpieces, From fantastical façades to rooftop warriors, Gaudí’s creativity will leave you in awe. And to top it off, you’ll enjoy a glass of cava to celebrate the beauty of Barcelona’s architectural gems!

• At Casa Batlló, you’ll step into a dreamlike world with a façade that’s like an oceanic masterpiece, complete with a dragon rooftop that’s pure magic.

• Explore the flowing stone and seaweed-inspired details at Casa Milà (La Pedrera), where the stunning courtyards, whale-like attic, and the rooftop warriors will leave you spellbound.

• Casa Vicens invites you to experience Gaudí’s first masterpiece, a vibrant, colorful design that sets the stage for everything that came after it.

• Finally, sip a glass of bubbly cava, celebrating the creativity, wonder, and genius behind these spectacular works of art.

activities.name: Barcelona Private Full-Day Walking Tour with Gothic Quarter
activities.description: See Barcelona like a local on the 8-hour private tour using public transportation. Jump on Barcelona’s efficient metro system and travel to all corners of the city, covering principal attractions and landmarks. This tour is customizable, allowing you to pick and choose the sights you most want to see. Your expert guide will help you navigate the extensive public transportation system and also share local knowledge and history.
